feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 11:58AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Indian River near Sitka including within The National Park. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 14 at 9:09AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Northern Inner Channels, Central Inner Channels and Eastern Gulf Coast. entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 14 at 12:42PM MST until September 14 at 3:45PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 1241 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 14 at 1:09AM PDT until September 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf. Surf will be 3- 5 feet, with sets to 6 feet. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 13 at 3:27PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect until 6AM on Friday . In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 2:03PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mesa County through 230 PM MDT... At 202 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Fruita, or 16 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 14 at 3:03PM CDT until September 14 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL HARRIS COUNTY... At 303 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sheldon, or near Barrett, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Llano County through 345 PM CDT... At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Castell, or 15 miles west of Llano, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MASON COUNTY THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 253 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Castell, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL VICTORIA COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wood Hi, or 12 miles southwest of Edna. This thunderstorm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 2:18PM CDT until September 14 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions Bosque, Erath, and Somervell Counties. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 14 at 2:03PM CDT until September 14 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN HARDIN COUNTY... At 203 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended across the warned area. However flash flooding remains likely. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 1:22PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES NUDGING ABOVE 110 DEGREES DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of humidity and near record to record high temperatures will nudge heat index values slightly above 110 degrees (111 to 113 degrees) for a few hours this afternoon, especially in the Brownsville and Port Isabel areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should
